abstract: A study by Hewlett-Packard shows how waste from cows on a dairy farm and heat from a data center nearby could be used profitably to produce electricity to run the data center.
snippet: A study by Hewlett-Packard shows how waste from cows on a dairy farm and heat from a data center nearby could be used profitably to produce electricity to run the data center.
lead_paragraph: Hey diddle diddle. Guess what the cow has done this time?

headline.main: One Moos and One Hums, but They Could Help Power Google
headline.print_headline: One Moos and One Hums, but They Could Help Power Google

abstract: Germany’s ban on naked short-selling of a variety of stocks, bonds and default swaps is not unusual, but may not be very effective either.
snippet: Germany’s ban on naked short-selling of a variety of stocks, bonds and default swaps is not unusual, but may not be very effective either.
lead_paragraph: The short-selling ban just announced by Germany misses the point. The country’s plan to stop naked shorting of some financial stocks and European government bonds as well as related credit-default swaps, starting Wednesday, may score political points. But it sows confusion, and will hardly help tackle the causes of Europe’s financial woes.

byline.original: By Peter Thal Larsen and Robert Cyran

abstract: Given that Cisco Systems, Microsoft and Google have tens of billions of dollars trapped outside the United States, young techies should consider basing or at least incorporating their new technology businesses overseas, Reuters Breakingviews suggests.
snippet: Given that Cisco Systems, Microsoft and Google have tens of billions of dollars trapped outside the United States, young techies should consider basing or at least incorporating their new technology businesses overseas, Reuters Breakingviews sugge...
lead_paragraph: It has become a rite of passage for young and ambitious computer wizards to pack their bags for California. But giants like Cisco Systems, Microsoft and Google have tens of billions of dollars trapped outside the United States.

headline.main: Should Entrepreneurs Look Abroad for the Big Deal?

abstract: Google chief Eric Schmidt said on Tuesday his company is prepared to fight the U.S. government “very hard” if regulators block the search leader’s acquisition of mobile advertising firm AdMob, Reuters reported.
snippet: Google chief Eric Schmidt said on Tuesday his company is prepared to fight the U.S. government “very hard” if regulators block the search leader’s acquisition of mobile advertising firm AdMob, Reuters reported.
lead_paragraph: Google’s chief, Eric E. Schmidt, said on Tuesday his company is prepared to fight the federal government “very hard” if regulators block the search leader’s acquisition of mobile advertising firm AdMob, Reuters reported.

headline.main: Google to Fight F.T.C. if AdMob Deal Is Blocked

abstract: Clicker, a search engine and programming guide for television shows and other video on the Web, showcased Clicker.tv on Wednesday at Google’s I/O conference.
snippet: Clicker, a search engine and programming guide for television shows and other video on the Web, showcased Clicker.tv on Wednesday at Google’s I/O conference.
lead_paragraph: Trying to navigate Web video using a computer that is hooked up to a television can feel a little like taking a driving test. You are forced to squint and strain to see each video thumbnail and link.

headline.main: A Program Guide for the Web, Designed for TVs

abstract: Adobe announced on Wednesday a free software upgrade for its Dreamweaver Web authoring software that adds new HTML5 functionality for developers and designers.
snippet: Adobe announced on Wednesday a free software upgrade for its Dreamweaver Web authoring software that adds new HTML5 functionality for developers and designers.
lead_paragraph: Adobe, the software company, showcased a new HTML5 addition to its Creative Suite software on Wednesday at the Google I/O developer conference.

headline.main: Adobe Offering New HTML5 Software Tools

abstract: Google delivered its vision of a Web-centric future to around 5,000 software developers at its annual I/O conference.
snippet: Google delivered its vision of a Web-centric future to around 5,000 software developers at its annual I/O conference.
lead_paragraph: Google delivered its vision of a Web-centric future on Wednesday in front of around 5,000 software developers at its annual Google I/O conference.

abstract: Brad Stone on YouTube’s past, present and future; Phil Simon, author of “The Next Wave of Technologies,” on IT challenges; a review of the Yeti USB mike from Blue Microphones; and news.
snippet: Brad Stone on YouTube’s past, present and future; Phil Simon, author of “The Next Wave of Technologies,” on IT challenges; a review of the Yeti USB mike from Blue Microphones; and news.
lead_paragraph: On this week’s Tech Talk podcast, Bettina Edelstein talks to Brad Stone about YouTube’s past, present and future. Five years after its debut as a quirky repository of online videos, YouTube says that more than two billion videos a day are viewed on the site. Its owner, Google, plans to expand its reach to the television set, and as Mr. Stone explains, YouTube is expected to play a important role in that effort.

abstract: Officials want to inspect a hard drive from one of Google’s roving vehicles used to compile its Street View photo mapping archive.
snippet: Officials want to inspect a hard drive from one of Google’s roving vehicles used to compile its Street View photo mapping archive.
lead_paragraph: BERLIN — Prosecutors in Hamburg opened a criminal investigation of Google on Wednesday over its collecting of private Internet data from unsecured Wi-Fi networks in Germany.

headline.print_headline: In Germany, a Criminal Inquiry Is Opened on Google’s Data-Gathering
